Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fibrinogen Concentrates in Dilutional Coagulopathy

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either fibryga® or Haemocomplettan® at doses of 50 or 100 mg/kg.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either fibryga® or Haemocomplettan® at doses of 50 or 100 mg/kg.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was clotting time (CT) and maximum clot firmness (MCF) measured by rotational thromboelastometry (ROTEM®).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 samples were randomised, 100 to each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on all samples using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Substitution with HES showed no difference between preparations, except for shorter thrombin time with fibryga® (p = 0.0093).

Funding.evidence: This study was funded by [source of funding].
